channel.title: How to Create a Video DVD from the CLI :: Salix Documentation
channel.description: It is very easy to create a video DVD out of your existing video files, using only command line tools. Universal solution using ffmpeg The original video files can be in any format that ffmpeg supports, so that includes just about everything. The tools you will need for this are ffmpeg and dvdauthor, so make sure you have them first (run as root): slapt-get -i ffmpeg dvdauthorUsing ffmpeg you can convert any video file to an mpg file, that dvdauthor can use later:
